comments:
I've imported an Eclipse 3.0 project into 3.1M7. The user libraries were 
imported but show as (unbound). 
Select an 'unbound' User Library and try to "Configure..." In the "Edit 
Library" dialog box click on the <User Libraries> button to get to the 
preferences page. Now click on <Import...> This generates an "Unhandled event 
loop exception" "Assertion failed; Path for IClasspathEntry must be absolute" 
error. No other dialog box appears.

Could you please attach your project for investigation?
Thanks.
Please also attach .log file or exception stack trace if any, thx

I have a similar bug in Eclipse SDK Version: 3.1.0, Build id: I20050610-1757.
When I select User Library -> Import, nothing happens in the UI. When I check
the error log, I have a stack trace for every time I hit the Import button. The
stack trace starts with the following:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2005-08-16 10:52:17.74
!MESSAGE Assertion failed; Path for IClasspathEntry must be absolute
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.Assert$AssertionFailedException: Assertion failed;
Path for IClasspathEntry must be absolute
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:89)

Created an attachment (id=26144)
Stack Trace from Help -> About -> View Error Log

Provided stack trace - the only plugins I have installed are CheckStyle 4.0.0
and XMLBuddy 2.0.62.

Further (baffling) information: I should point out that my workspace was stored
underneath my Eclipse home directory (c:\java\eclipse-3.1\workspace\), with my
workspace projects referenced from locations outside the workspace (e.g.
c:\projects\myproject). 

When I switch my workspace to an external location (e.g. c:\projects), the User
Library -> Import function appears to work as expected.

Steps to replicate:

1. Import legal user library using Windows -> Preferences -> Java -> Build Path
-> User Libraries -> Import.
2. Modify .userlibraries file externally to use classpath variables e.g. ${CORE}
as opposed to an absolute path in URI form.
3. Hit import again. 

What should happen:

Import dialog box should appear, at least saying that the file is invalid.

What actually happens:

Nothing in the UI. Stack trace added to error log.

This bug is a duplicate of bug 93061 and should be marked accordingly.

This seems to be a problem with Mac OS X installation of 3.1 also. The behavior is identical. In my case, 
the location of the workspace is outside the eclipse installation directory (/Users/tayub/workspace).
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 93061 ***

traces.message: Assertion failed; Path for IClasspathEntry must be absolute
